body.name: phonicgrid Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones Wireless Bluetooth Headphones With Mic, Over Ear Wireless Headphones With Deep Bass, Carry Case, Bluetooth 5.2, 30H for Travel/Office, Carbon Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 13 hrs 58 mins
features: [Immerse in Music Without Noise]: With the updated noise cancelling technology, open the ANC mode to enhance your music listening. Reduce up to 95% of low-frequency noises around you. Listen to clearer lyrics, fully immersed in your favorite music with the active noise canceling headphones.

[Amazing Quality of Audio]: The 40mm large drivers transmit every detail of audio to your ears perfectly, so you can hear your music exactly as it was intended to be heard. Deliver truly impeccable sound quality for you, the advanced speaker diaphragm and chip make quality.

[Crystal Clear Calls]: Thanks to premium built-in microphones and bluetooth 5.2 technology, the wireless headphones provide crystal clear and stable hands-free calls. Due to ENC Tech - Environment Noise Cancelling, no more poor conversations.

[All-Day Comfort, With Carry Case]: The lightweight design and super imitation protein leather make for a no-pressure and comfortable fit, so you can wear them all day long with ease. The wireless headphones are made for ultimate comfort and relaxation. It is a good choice for travel with a carry case for easy carrying.

[30 Hours Playtime]: A full charge for 30 hours of continuous music playback time. Adjustable headband for a more comfortable fit. Having a longer time for comfortable listening with the over ear headphones is never a difficulty. Nice for business calls, music listening for relaxation, and personal quiet space in the office.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure what the price on these will be when you're reading this review, but I got them for the sale price of $29.99. And wow! That's a HELL OF A DEAL.In my review, I've given the noise cancellation five stars; if I had paid $150 for them, I would have rated it four stars, which means I would have been reasonably happy with how well the feature works even at that price.I can't speak to the battery life because I've yet to charge them; I've been using them for about five hours straight, and it has dawned me that they are extremely comfortable even during long periods of use.Also, their VOLUME CONTROL IS BETTER THAN ANY OTHER HEADPHONES’ I'VE EVER HAD BEFORE. For whatever reason, three different pairs of headphones have had compatibility with issues my brand-new laptop's Bluetooth (to make a long story short, there was no middle ground in the volume; it was either too quiet or too loud); I expected these phonicgrid E7s to have the same weird problems as the others, but they don't. As a result, I'm so happy with my purchase that I've decided to give them a glowing review right now, even before having used them for an entire battery charge.I did not expect these phonicgrid E7 headphones to be as overall great as they are; I bought these because my Soundcore Life Q30 headphones are old, and their battery life has drastically degraded. I really, really liked the Soundcore Life Q30s when I first got them; I thought they were one of the best purchases I had ever made, and I would still rate them five stars (they lasted long enough and are overall excellent for the price). However, their battery degraded more quickly than I anticipated. Admittedly, I dropped them a few times. Oopsies.However, the person I live with has a brand-new pair of the Soundcore Life Q30s (because of my recommendation I might add), and she let me borrow them so that I could do a direct comparison between her new headphones (the Soundcore Life Q30s) and my new headphones (the phonicgrid E7s). Below are the results.The phonicgrid E7's noise cancellation is comparable to the Soundcore Life Q30's. The Soundcore Life Q30s do have superior sound quality, higher quality materials, and I would imagine better battery life (if they're brand new)--but these phonicgrid E7s are superior in other ways; they're also no slouch on sound quality (and allegedly no slouch on battery life). . . . The phonicgrid E7s are much more comfortable, much lighter, have much better volume control (as well as better compatibility with my laptop's Bluetooth [but that is only one device and therefore a negligible sample size]), and they're CHEAPER! . . . Also, do you really want higher quality materials in your headphones? When it comes to metal and plastic, higher quality means harder and heavier--so, if you accidentally drop the headphones on your face, it will hurt more. Moreover, lighter headphones mean less strain on the neck and therefore the ability to use them for longer periods of time.In the areas where the Soundcore Life Q30s are superior to the phonicgrid E7s, the gap is small; in the areas where phonicgrid E7s are superior to the Soundcore Life Q30s, the gap is large. Overall, I would say that at the $29.99 price I paid for them, the phonicgrid E7s are a significantly better purchase than the Soundcore Life Q30s even though both are excellent values.In summation, if these phonicgrid E7s are on sale for anywhere near the price that I paid for them (which again, was $29.99), I suggest that you buy them immediately--before the sale ends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good, dependable headphones
reviews.reviewText: I use them in the office where I can listen to music without hearing the chatterboxes near me. Good noise cancelling feature. Good set of headphones at a good price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good for the price
reviews.reviewText: It isn't noise canceling but does reduce outside noise. The sound quality is really good, they are also comfortable to wear. The battery life is long. I use them at work every day

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These headphones are solid with metal attachments. The noise cancellation is so good I couldn’t hear my cat purring when she was sitting on my chest. I bought them because the price was great and just figured I’d give them a try. So worth it !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: After hours of searching and reading reviews, I decided to purchase that E7 active noise canceling headphones which includes a microphone and affordable price. I am very happy with my purchase. It’s been over a month and I already used it for travel( ANC wonderful for plane noises) talking on the phone while doing house work (very clear) and listening to music. It’s just perfect and I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly high quality
reviews.reviewText: So I was a bit skeptical at first since these headphones looked like one of those cheap knockoffs you'd get at family dollar or something but nope. They are surprisingly loud and the bass is perfect (for my standard anyway) I bought these when they were on sale but these are the best quality headphones I've had in a long while

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked better than expected
reviews.reviewText: Bought these for long flights and they were excellent for suppressing the background noise. Sound, watching movies or listening to music, was also very nice. Liked them so much we purchased a second set.

reviews.reviewText: Best headsets for the price. Much better than the more expensive brands. My family owns 3 pair.
